snippet: The employee was stabbed in the chest after a fight behind the Al Oerter Recreation Center in Queens, and a co-worker was held, the authorities said.
abstract: New York City Parks Dept employee Ezra Black is fatally stabbed behind the Al Oerter Recreation Center in Queens, where he worked, after a getting into an altercation with co-worker Robert Swann; police apprehend Swann in nearby Flushing Meadows-Corona Park. (M)2
lead_paragraph: An employee with the New York City parks department was fatally stabbed on Tuesday near a recreation center in Queens after a fight with a fellow worker, the authorities said. The attack occurred in a lot behind the Al Oerter Recreation Center , on Fowler Avenue, in Flushing, about 3:15 p.m., the police said. The victim, Ezra Black, 31, of East 38th Street in Brooklyn, was stabbed in the chest, the police said.

headline.main: Parks Dept. Worker Is Killed in Queens
